citation.article-title: Oxalobacter formigenes gen. nov., sp. nov.: oxalate-degrading anaerobes that inhabit the gastrointestinal tract.

p.s: Description of Oxalobacter formigenes sp. nov.
Oxalobacter formigenes (form.i.ge'nes M.L.n. acidum formicum formic acid; Gr. v. gennaio produce; M.L. adj. formigenes formic acid producing)
Type species of the genus Oxalobacter.
The type strain of Oxalobacter formigenes is strain OxB.
This strain was isolated from the rumen of a sheep and has been deposited with the American Type Culture Collection, where it has been assigned the number ATCC 35274.
The description of the type strain is as given above for the genus and species.
It is proposed that this organism be placed in the family Bacteroidaceae.
